alert.note: Alert for Atlantic; Atlantic Coastal Cape May; Cape May; Coastal Atlantic (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued January 09 at 9:09AM EST until January 10 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 10 AM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Up to one foot of inundation above ground level expected in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways. * WHERE...Atlantic, Cape May, Atlantic Coastal Cape May and Coastal Atlantic. * WHEN...From 5 PM this afternoon to 10 AM EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...At this level, flooding begins on the most vulnerable roads in coastal and bayside communities, and along inland tidal waterways. Some partial or full road closures are possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The highest water levels are expected in the back bays. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. Atlantic Ocean at Atlantic City MLLW Categories - Minor 6.0 ft, Moderate 7.0 ft, Major 8.0 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.4 ft, Moderate 2.4 ft, Major 3.4 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- -------- 09/06 PM 5.7 1.1 2.6 None 10/06 AM 6.6 2.0 1.8 Minor 10/06 PM 3.5 -1.1 0.3 None 11/07 AM 5.2 0.6 0.1 None 11/08 PM 3.7 -0.9 0.3 None Great Egg Harbor Bay at Ocean City MLLW Categories - Minor 5.3 ft, Moderate 6.3 ft, Major 7.3 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.3 ft, Moderate 2.3 ft, Major 3.3 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- -------- 09/06 PM 5.6 1.6 2.7 Minor 10/06 AM 5.8 1.8 1.4 Minor 10/07 PM 2.8 -1.2 -0.3 None 11/07 AM 4.4 0.4 -0.3 None 11/08 PM 3.0 -1.0 -0.2 None Cape May Harbor at Cape May MLLW Categories - Minor 6.2 ft, Moderate 7.2 ft, Major 8.2 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.1 ft, Moderate 2.1 ft, Major 3.1 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- -------- 09/06 PM 6.5 1.4 3.0 Minor 10/06 AM 6.5 1.4 1.2 Minor 10/07 PM 3.7 -1.4 0.0 None 11/07 AM 5.7 0.6 0.1 None 11/08 PM 4.0 -1.1 0.1 None &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
